doc.field: Records of the Reiss Center on Law and Security
Records of the Reiss Center on Law and Security

The Reiss Center on Law and Security is a non-partison multidisciplinary research institute at NYU School of Law. Founded in 2003 as the Center on Law and Security and renamed in 2018, the center facilitates dialogue and produces research on legal, policy, and strategic issues in the field of national security. The Reiss Center holds public events, conferences, and workshops; hosts policy groups; produces research and writing in both academic and popular media; sponsors fellowships from leading experts in the field; and offers academic programs for students at NYU School of Law. This collection consists of publications issued by the Reiss Center for Law and Security, and includes reports and issue briefs concerning security law, foreign policy, military affairs, and national security strategy.

This collection consists of publications issued by the Reiss Center for Law and Security, and includes reports and issue briefs concerning security law, foreign policy, military affairs, and national security strategy.

This collection consists of publications issued by the Reiss Center for Law and Security at the NYU School of Law. Materials include reports and issue briefs concerning security law, foreign policy, military affairs, and national security strategy.

The Reiss Center on Law and Security is a non-partison multidisciplinary research institute at NYU School of Law. Founded in 2003 as the Center on Law and Security and renamed in 2018, the center facilitates dialogue and produces research on legal, policy, and strategic issues in the field of national security. The Reiss Center holds public events, conferences, and workshops; hosts policy groups; produces research and writing in both academic and popular media; sponsors fellowships from leading experts in the field; and offers academic programs for students at NYU School of Law.
Transferred by the Reiss Center for Law and Security in March 2019; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2019.038.
